website_summaries.verdict: An engaging entry-level book on web design fundamentals, although some readers felt that it did not get into enough detail.
pros: Everything from learning how to plan and develop your site to search engine optimization and promotion
Well laid out with a lot of examples
cons: Some felt that it was a little too bare bones, and that it didn't get very deep into the various topics

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent introduction to webdesign for anybody who wants to learn ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent introduction to webdesign for anybody who wants to learn how to create websites for the real world. It's also a great tool to get those who already know the basics up to current standards. Stefan Mischook focuses on essential parts and only provides the background details that actually matter. No time wasted dissecting frogs, this book takes you directly to the meat of webdesign. The cover says 'A no-Nonsence, Jargon-Free Guide to the Fundamentals of Web Design" and that is exactly what this book delivers.

customer_reviews.title: Can't find source files
customer_reviews.text: I was originally i the print design program and I am now switching to the web design program. I am using this book as refresher because the print program has only one coding class. I love this book so far and would love to rate it 5 stars but I can't. I am at chapter 4 in the book and I cannot find the source files he mentions that are the site his lists on page 7 of the book. I even used the sites search bar by typing source files. Nothing comes up. If someone could please point me in the right direction I would gladly change my reveiw to 5 stars.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Easy to Follow
customer_reviews.text: This book is amazing. I am as beginner as beginner can be when it comes to website design. This book helped me understand the language and the basics. However, just as my confidence was growing (toward last 1/4 of book) the author throws a lot of other coding languages at you and I got confused and lost. He begins by going slow and methodically but about 3/4 of the way through changes speed and assumes I know what I do not know. Still, very much worth the buying as I now know what I want in a website. I will be able to work with my designer, setting up a site that I WILL MANAGE. This is huge.

customer_reviews.title: Great introduction to web design
customer_reviews.text: Great introduction to web design This is an excellent book anyone who has no programming experience. This book teaches the reader with the skills to build a simple, clean, and professional looking website. The first half of the book covers basic HTML and CSS, while the second hard dives deeper into the topics and fill in the details (HTML5/CSS3). This book is very easy to read and nicely illustrated. Unlike other boring reference type books, advance topics such as CMS (eg. WordPress, Drupal), JavaScript, jQuery, and Bootstrap frameworks are briefly introduced. The author teaches the concepts and relevant technologies to inspire the interested readers to find out more.
